title: T4 Manipulator Replacement
purpose: Remove and replace a T4 manipulator.
Restore full hydraulic and mechanical functionality after installation.
safety: Ensure ROV hydraulics and instrumentation are powered off before starting.
Secure the T4 manipulator at all times to prevent uncontrolled movement.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves and eye protection.

steps.title: Prepare for removal
text: Ensure ROV hydraulics and instrumentation are powered off.
Secure the T4 manipulator by wrapping a soft sling around the elbow and connecting it to the crane.
Prepare oil rags and spill control materials.

steps.title: Disconnect services
text: Disconnect all hydraulic hoses from the T4, including main and compensator lines.
Disconnect the electrical/data cable.
Cap all hoses immediately to prevent oil loss and contamination.

steps.title: Remove mounting bolts
text: Untorque the six mounting bolts located under the shoulder.
Remove four bolts initially, leaving two bolts in place to retain alignment.
Prepare the crane and ensure all personnel are clear.
Remove the remaining two bolts once ready to lift.

steps.title: Lift and store manipulator
text: Carefully lift the T4 clear of the base using the crane.
Transfer and secure the manipulator in the designated storage or transport box.

steps.title: Prepare for installation
text: Prepare the replacement T4 manipulator.
Install two guide bolts into the shoulder mounting holes on the base.
Wrap a sling around the elbow of the T4 and connect it to the crane rigging.

steps.title: Install manipulator
text: Lift the T4 into position above the base.
Ensure the arrow indicator on the T4 is pointing forward.
Lower the T4 until the guide bolts enter the mounting holes.
Install four mounting bolts and hand-tighten only.
Secure the T4 to prevent movement by slinging the elbow to nearby gratings.
Remove the two guide bolts.
Install the remaining two mounting bolts.

steps.title: Torque and reconnect
text: Torque all six mounting bolts to 108 Nm using a calibrated torque wrench.
Disconnect the crane.
Reconnect all hydraulic hoses and electrical/data cables.
Fill the compensator with hydraulic oil and bleed air as required.

steps.title: Bleed system
text: Power on the ROV and start the hydraulic system.
Move the T4 to its maximum upward position.
Secure the T4 in this position using a sling.
Connect the filling hose to the valve pack compensator.
Place a bucket beneath the T4 to collect oil.
Slightly loosen the camera cover bolts at the highest point to allow air and oil to escape.
Continue filling until oil flows without air bubbles.
Retighten and torque the camera cover bolts.
Fill the compensator to the correct level.

steps.title: Functional test and shutdown
text: Operate all joints of the T4 to confirm correct function.
Remove all slings.
Inspect for oil leaks.
Recheck and top up compensator oil level if required.
Park the T4 and shut down ROV hydraulics once satisfied.

notes: Always confirm torque values against the latest T4 torque reference.
Maintain communication with the control room throughout the procedure.
Record the manipulator replacement in the maintenance log.
